info.title: RDX Rest API
info.description: List of endpoints and schemas to create, update, delete and search entities and their sub-entities supported by RDX server

get.summary: Returns latest versions of all matching Acuris Prime industries in json format. This action requires the caller entitled to view Acuris Prime industries

externalDocs.description: Refer to xRS Documentation for more details to use in filter paramters

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters to be applied. This query parameter can be repeated to apply multiple filters. Format : EntityField,Operator,Value1,...ValueN. Where EntityField is any of the Acuris Prime industry field. Operator is the operator symbol and value1..n refers to the operator value(s).  Multiple values can be passed separated by commas if Operator require/accepts multiple values. For possible EntityFields, refer to the schema section for AcurisPrimeIndustry Please refer to xRS documentation for supported operators.

Filter by Code, not in operator.description: Filter by Code, not in operator

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma separated list of Acuris Prime industry fields to be returned in the resultant json. If not provided, all fields will be returned.  For possible list of fields, refer to the schema section for AcurisPrimeIndustry

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Use this to specify the filter criteria in an Excel-like syntax(as mentioned in examples)to apply complex filter criteria. Please refer to xRS documentation for details on syntex of 'where' clause.

Complex filters such as (Id contains \"A.description: Complex filters such as (Id contains "ABC" OR Code = "DEF") AND Name != "XYZ"
Complex filters such as (Id contains \"A.value: AND( OR( SEARCH(Id, "ABC") != -1, Code = "DEF"), NOT( Name = "XYZ" ))

parameters.name: composeFiltersOR
parameters.description: Indicates whether the other filters are Or-ed. By Default, the filters are and-ed

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort by clause. This query parameter can be repeated to apply sorting on multiple filters. Sorting can be applied on any Acuris Prime industry field. For possible fields, refer to the schema section for AcurisPrimeIndustry

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: Maximum number of returned Acuris Prime industries

200.description: Indicates successful  in receiving  all matching Acuris Prime industries. The response body would be a json containing resultant set.

ETag.description: ETag of the existing resource in format rootEntityId:revisionId if a specific resource is asked

Location.description: Location of the existing resource if a specific resource is asked

post.summary: Creates a new Acuris Prime industry. This action requires the caller entitled to create Acuris Prime industries
post.description:
Creates a new  Acuris Prime industry.
 The Id property is optional, if not provided it will auto generate an Id.
Fields required for creation are Code,Name.
 For possible entity Fields, refer to the schema section for AcurisPrimeIndustry. This action requires the caller entitled to create Acuris Prime industries

requestBody.description: A json containing field/values to be set while creating the Acuris Prime industry

201.description: Indicates successful  creation of Acuris Prime industry. The response body would contain the created Acuris Prime industry

ETag.description: ETag of the created entity in format rootEntityId:revisionId

Location.description: Location of the created entity

500.description: Internal server error / Request not processable / Four-Eyes request submission failed

delete.summary: Deletes an existing Acuris Prime industry subject to caller is entitled to delete Acuris Prime industries
delete.description:
Deletes a existing Acuris Prime industry.
. This action is subject to caller is entitled to delete Acuris Prime industries

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: Id of Acuris Prime industry

204.description: Indicates successful  deletion of  the specific Acuris Prime industry

412.description: Data deletion was done on an outdated revision

500.description: Internal server error / Request not processable / Four-Eyes request submission failed

patch.summary: Updates an existing Acuris Prime industry subject to caller is entitled to edit Acuris Prime industries
patch.description:
Updates a existing Acuris Prime industry.
 The Id property is optional, if not provided it will auto generate an Id.
Fields required to be passed while editing are Code,Name.
 For possible entity Fields, refer to the schema section for AcurisPrimeIndustry in json format, subject to caller is entitled to edit Acuris Prime industries

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: Id of Acuris Prime industry

requestBody.description: A json containing field/values to be updated in the specified Acuris Prime industry

200.description: Indicates successful  update of  the specific Acuris Prime industry. The response body would be a json containing updated entity.

ETag.description: ETag of the updated entity in format rootEntityId:revisionId

Location.description: Location of the updated entity

412.description: Data change was done on an outdated revision

500.description: Internal server error / Request not processable / Four-Eyes request submission failed

parameters.description: Id of Counterparty

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma separated list of Contact fields to be returned in the resultant json. If not provided, all fields will be returned.  For possible list of fields, refer to the schema section for Contact

parameters.name: composeFiltersOR
parameters.description: Indicates whether the other filters are Or-ed. By Default, the filters are and-ed

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: Maximum number of returned Contacts

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters to be applied. This query parameter can be repeated to apply multiple filters. Format : EntityField,Operator,Value1,...ValueN. Where EntityField is any of the Contact field. Operator is the operator symbol and value1..n refers to the operator value(s).  Multiple values can be passed separated by commas if Operator require/accepts multiple values. For possible EntityFields, refer to the schema section for Contact Please refer to xRS documentation for supported operators.

Filter by Description, not in operator.description: Filter by Description, not in operator

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort by clause. This query parameter can be repeated to apply sorting on multiple filters. Sorting can be applied on any Contact field. For possible fields, refer to the schema section for Contact

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Use this to specify the filter criteria in an Excel-like syntax(as mentioned in examples)to apply complex filter criteria. Please refer to xRS documentation for details on syntex of 'where' clause.

Complex filters such as (Description con.description: Complex filters such as (Description contains "ABC" OR Email = "DEF") AND EntitySubtype != "XYZ"
Complex filters such as (Description con.value: AND( OR( SEARCH(Description, "ABC") != -1, Email = "DEF"), NOT( EntitySubtype = "XYZ" ))

200.description: Indicates successful  in receiving  all matching Contacts belonging to the parent Counterparty. The response body would be a json containing resultant set.

ETag.description: ETag of the existing resource in format rootEntityId:revisionId if a specific resource is asked

Location.description: Location of the existing resource if a specific resource is asked

get.summary: Returns latest versions of all matching Feed configs belonging to the parent Entity config in json format. This action requires the caller entitled to view Feed configs

externalDocs.description: Refer to xRS Documentation for more details to use in filter paramters

parameters.name: Id
parameters.description: Id of Entity config

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma separated list of Feed config fields to be returned in the resultant json. If not provided, all fields will be returned.  For possible list of fields, refer to the schema section for FeedConfig

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort by clause. This query parameter can be repeated to apply sorting on multiple filters. Sorting can be applied on any Feed config field. For possible fields, refer to the schema section for FeedConfig

parameters.name: composeFiltersOR
parameters.description: Indicates whether the other filters are Or-ed. By Default, the filters are and-ed

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Use this to specify the filter criteria in an Excel-like syntax(as mentioned in examples)to apply complex filter criteria. Please refer to xRS documentation for details on syntex of 'where' clause.

Complex filters such as (ChainName conta.description: Complex filters such as (ChainName contains "ABC" OR Filter = "DEF") AND FeedIdField != "XYZ"
Complex filters such as (ChainName conta.value: AND( OR( SEARCH(ChainName, "ABC") != -1, Filter = "DEF"), NOT( FeedIdField = "XYZ" ))

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: Maximum number of returned Feed configs

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters to be applied. This query parameter can be repeated to apply multiple filters. Format : EntityField,Operator,Value1,...ValueN. Where EntityField is any of the Feed config field. Operator is the operator symbol and value1..n refers to the operator value(s).  Multiple values can be passed separated by commas if Operator require/accepts multiple values. For possible EntityFields, refer to the schema section for FeedConfig Please refer to xRS documentation for supported operators.

Filter by ChainName, not in operator.description: Filter by ChainName, not in operator

200.description: Indicates successful  in receiving  all matching Feed configs belonging to the parent Entity config. The response body would be a json containing resultant set.

ETag.description: ETag of the existing resource in format rootEntityId:revisionId if a specific resource is asked

Location.description: Location of the existing resource if a specific resource is asked

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Filters to be applied. This query parameter can be repeated to apply multiple filters. Format : EntityField,Operator,Value1,...ValueN. Where EntityField is any of the Feed field. Operator is the operator symbol and value1..n refers to the operator value(s).  Multiple values can be passed separated by commas if Operator require/accepts multiple values. For possible EntityFields, refer to the schema section for Feed Please refer to xRS documentation for supported operators.

Filter by Currency, not in operator.description: Filter by Currency, not in operator

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort by clause. This query parameter can be repeated to apply sorting on multiple filters. Sorting can be applied on any Feed field. For possible fields, refer to the schema section for Feed

parameters.name: composeFiltersOR
parameters.description: Indicates whether the other filters are Or-ed. By Default, the filters are and-ed

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Use this to specify the filter criteria in an Excel-like syntax(as mentioned in examples)to apply complex filter criteria. Please refer to xRS documentation for details on syntex of 'where' clause.

Complex filters such as (Currency contai.description: Complex filters such as (Currency contains "ABC" OR Source = "DEF") AND Name != "XYZ"
Complex filters such as (Currency contai.value: AND( OR( SEARCH(Currency, "ABC") != -1, Source = "DEF"), NOT( Name = "XYZ" ))

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: Maximum number of returned Feeds

200.description: Indicates successful  in receiving  the specific Feed. The response body would be a json containing resultant set.

Where EntityField is any of the Inheritable field field. Operator is the operator symbol and value1..n refers to the operator value(s).  Multiple values can be passed separated by commas if Operator require/accepts multiple values. For possible EntityFields, refer to the schema section for InheritableField Please refer to xRS documentation for supported operators.

Filter by EntityClass, not in operator.description: Filter by EntityClass, not in operator

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description: Maximum number of returned Inheritable fields

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Use this to specify the filter criteria in an Excel-like syntax(as mentioned in examples)to apply complex filter criteria. Please refer to xRS documentation for details on syntex of 'where' clause.

Complex filters such as (EntityClass con.description: Complex filters such as (EntityClass contains "ABC" OR Id = "DEF") AND Name != "XYZ"
Complex filters such as (EntityClass con.value: AND( OR( SEARCH(EntityClass, "ABC") != -1, Id = "DEF"), NOT( Name = "XYZ" ))

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Sort by clause. This query parameter can be repeated to apply sorting on multiple filters. Sorting can be applied on any Inheritable field field. For possible fields, refer to the schema section for InheritableField

200.description: Indicates successful  in receiving  all matching Inheritable fields. The response body would be a json containing resultant set.

ETag.description: ETag of the existing resource in format rootEntityId:revisionId if a specific resource is asked

Location.description: Location of the existing resource if a specific resource is asked

Active.description: Activation status. Possible values: 0 - Inactive, 1 - Active

Id.description: Primary identifier of the Analysis code
Primary identifier of the Attachment base

Active.description: When Event Type = BIC EXPIRED or BIC SUSPENDED then false, else true.. Possible values: 0 - Inactive, 1 - Active

CountryName1.description: Country name where the bank identified by this BIC is located

CountryName2.description: Country name where the bank identified by this BIC is located

EventType.description: The event or change description related to the BIC that has occurred in the past, in the present, or will occur in the future.

Id.description: Primary identifier of the BIC. If not provided while creating BIC the id is internally generated. This field cannot be edited.

ImportTime.description: Date and time the BICplus file was imported into Message Manager.

Unpublished.description: Indicates if the BIC is non-publicly available. A non-public available BIC is a still valid 11-char BIC code but the regular SWIFT files do not provide those. It can assume only two values: 1 if the BIC is NON-publicly available, 0 otherwise.

Default.description: BIC type is used as default.

SecurityType.description: Security Type.. Possible values: 0 - Undef, 1 - Fwd, 2 - Cash, 3 - Basis, 4 - Future, 5 - Option, 6 - Swap, 7 - Switch, 8 - Repo, 11 - Strategy, 12 - CDS, 13 - Equity, 14 - Fund, 15 - FX, 16 - CDS Curve, 17 - Repo Basket, 18 - MMCurvePoint, 19 - MMCurve

Ticker.description: The ticker of the issuer of the bond.

items.description: List of entities to be excluded from the group in spite of falling into the rule criteria (JSON array)
List of groups to be included (JSON array)

Id.description: Identifier of the Group used as record/chain ID and within other technical APIs. Only alpha-numeric characters and underscores are allowed.
